intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. leucotephrodes, commonly known as the white-topped hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its flowers are yellow with white ray florets, and it produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. It is often found in dry, sunny environments and is considered a characteristic species of certain ecological communities.
